newsitem.title: UK: UK will not take part in fudged EMU - Blair.
newsitem.headline: UK will not take part in fudged EMU - Blair.

text.p: Labour leader Tony Blair said on Tuesday that if he won the May 1 UK election he would not take Britain into a fudged single currency.
In what aides said was his most sceptical speech yet on Europe, Blair said it was not even certain that economic and monetary union would start on schedule in 1999.
He told businessmen in Derby that any decision to join EMU would have to be ratified by a referendum.

There is no question of it being imposed on the country, slunk through undercover or by a sidewind. Even for such a proposition to be made, we would have to be absolutely sure that it would be in Britains interests - British jobs, British investment, British industry.
We would not join in any fudged single currency or one not in Britains interests. Period,, Blair said in his speech.

Aides said Blair wanted to spell out an uncompromising line on EMU on the first formal day of the election campaign to head off accusations by the ruling Conservatives that a Labour government would sell out Britains national interests in Europe.
